title: [ERROR] not available; Try making some of these repositories available
body:
datalad get on openneuro datasets(?) often fails with these error messages.

```
[ERROR] not available; Try making some of these repositories available:; 	30982af9-1bcd-4f66-8e56-79cc3143b587 -- root@79cd556289f8:/datalad/ds001219 [get(/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/openneuro/ds001219/sub-07/anat/sub-07_T1w.nii.gz)] 

[ERROR] not available; Try making some of these repositories available:; 	30982af9-1bcd-4f66-8e56-79cc3143b587 -- root@79cd556289f8:/datalad/ds001219 [get(/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/openneuro/ds001219/sub-06/anat/sub-06_T1w.nii.gz)] 

[ERROR] not available; Try making some of these repositories available:; 	30982af9-1bcd-4f66-8e56-79cc3143b587 -- root@79cd556289f8:/datalad/ds001219 [get(/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/openneuro/ds001219/sub-08/anat/sub-08_T1w.nii.gz)] 

[ERROR] not available; Try making some of these repositories available:; 	30982af9-1bcd-4f66-8e56-79cc3143b587 -- root@79cd556289f8:/datalad/ds001219 [get(/mnt/datalad/datasets.datalad.org/openneuro/ds001219/sub-10/anat/sub-10_T1w.nii.gz)] 
```

When I try it on a later day, I am often able to "get" the entire dataset. I think there is something wrong on openneuro/s3 end, but I am not sure.. Should I contact OpenNeuro instead?

Also, is there a way to crawl through all datalad datasets to make sure which dataset are currently assessible? I guess I can just try dataset get/drop on a random file from each dataset periodically?
